short_description: This is a driver function to build a single tree model
long_description: The Single_Tree_Drive function takes the entire data set as training input and builds a single decision tree from it

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queenâ€™s IP saddress or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeTableName
argument_clauses.description: The name of the table containing the attribute names and the values.

argument_clauses.name: CategoricalAttributeTableName
argument_clauses.description: The name of the input table containing the categorical attributes.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseTableName
argument_clauses.description: The name of the table containing the response values.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.description: The name for the output table that is to contain the final decision tree

argument_clauses.name: SplitsTable
argument_clauses.description: The name of the input table that contains the user-specified splits.

argument_clauses.name: IntermediateSplitsTable
argument_clauses.description: The name for the intermediate splits table, if it is to be saved.

argument_clauses.name: SplitsValueColumn
argument_clauses.description: the name of the column containing the split value

argument_clauses.name: NumSplits
argument_clauses.description: The number of splits to consider for each variable. The input value must be no less than 1. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: ApproxSplits
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use approximate percentiles The default value is true.

argument_clauses.name: DropTable
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to drop the output table The default value is false.

argument_clauses.name: MinNodeSize
argument_clauses.description: A decision tree stopping criterion The default value is 100.

argument_clauses.name: MaxDepth
argument_clauses.description: A decision tree stopping criterion. The input value must be no less than 1 and no greater than 60. The default value is 5.

argument_clauses.name: SplitMeasure
argument_clauses.description: The impurity measurement to be used while constructing the decision tree. The permitted input values are [GINI, ENTROPY, CHISQUARE]. The default value is gini.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeNameColumns
argument_clauses.description: The names of attribute table columns that define the attribute.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeValueColumn
argument_clauses.description: The names of attribute table columns that define the value.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumn
argument_clauses.description: The name of the column in the response table that contains the response.

argument_clauses.name: IdColumns
argument_clauses.description: The names of the columns in the response and attribute tables that specify the ID of the instance.

argument_clauses.name: Weighted
argument_clauses.description: Whether to add weighted option or not The default value is false.

argument_clauses.name: WeightColumn
argument_clauses.description: weight column in the table Input columns must contain numeric SQL types.
